title: 112_hr6659
content: The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" is cited as the short title. It extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specific cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Economic development extension bonds issued within a specified timeframe are treated as qualified bonds with adjusted percentage rates and interest inclusion in gross income. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specific cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Specified bonds issued within a 1-year period must meet certain criteria to be designated for qualified purposes. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specific cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. A specified bond is any obligation (other than a private activity bond) where the interest would be excludable from gross income under section 103. Certain rules apply for determining specified bonds, and section 148 does not apply if the excess described in paragraph (1)(A) is used for a qualified purpose. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 148 does not apply if the excess from paragraph (1)(A) is used for qualified purposes, including economic development and refinancing of indebtedness for specified cities. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities with high unemployment rates and population loss between 2000 and 2010. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities with high unemployment rates and population loss between 2000 and 2010. The maximum aggregate face amount of bonds designated for a city cannot exceed the bond limitation allocated based on the city's population. The Secretary allocates bond limitation to specified cities based on population proportions. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. Extension of recovery zone economic development bonds for certain cities, effective for obligations issued after the enactment of this Act.
